intro: Myosotis × permixta, commonly known as the hybrid forget-me-not, is a perennial flowering plant that belongs to the Boraginaceae family. It is a natural hybrid resulting from the cross between Myosotis sylvatica and Myosotis ramosa, combining characteristics of both parent species. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces clusters of blue to purple flowers with five petals. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Myosotis × permixta is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also found in woodland and meadow habitats.
